name: Lookahead
overview: Lookahead is a 1 - 2 player strategy came for the 8-bit Atari computer. Played on a 7 x 7 game board, the playing field consists of numbers and unknown squares. Player one can only move horizontally, and player 2 can move only vertically, and players score points depending on the square they land on. The goal is to have more points than the opponent when no plays are left. There are 3 levels of computer opponents, and the player can chose the highest available number, and whether there are unknown squares.
